question: 大人
sourceMnemonic: This kanji combines <kanji>big</kanji> and <kanji>person</kanji>. If you're a child, how do you think of adults? You just think of them like big people. That's why this combination of kanji means <vocabulary>adult</vocabulary>, and when used like an adjective, it means <vocabulary>mature</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: "I'm an <kanji>adult</kanji>, which means I have adult responsibilities. <reading>Oh, Toner</reading> (<ja>おとな</ja>)? I need some of that for my terrible printer..." ... now feel so sad you have such a terrible printer that runs out of toner every day. Ohhhh Toner!
